title: How to Upload Your Resume
summary: Upload your resume via drag & drop during onboarding or from your dashboard settings.
canonical_questions: How do I upload my resume?
Where can I add my CV?
answer: You can upload your resume in two ways: 1) During the onboarding flow after selecting your career goal, you'll see a drag & drop area. Simply drag your PDF or DOCX file onto the area, or click 'Browse Files' to select it. 2) From your dashboard, navigate to Settings → Profile → Resume and click 'Update Resume'.
step_by_step: Drag and drop your file (PDF, DOC, DOCX)
Wait for the scanning animation to complete
Verify your resume appears in the preview
examples: Accepted formats: PDF, DOC, DOCX (max 10MB)
Processing typically takes 5-10 seconds
if_not_work: Ensure file is under 10MB
Try a different browser if upload fails
Clear cache and retry
Contact support if issue persists

title: Selecting Your Career Goal
summary: Choose between Promotion, Career Pivot, or Professional Growth to personalize your Kintsu experience.
canonical_questions: What career goals can I select?
How do I choose my goal?
Can I change my career goal later?
answer: Kintsu offers three career paths: **Promotion** (advancing in your current field), **Career Pivot** (transitioning to a new industry or role), and **Professional Growth** (expanding skills and expertise). Your selection personalizes the AI Coach recommendations, job matches, and career insights you receive.
step_by_step: During onboarding, you'll see three goal cards
Review each option: Promotion, Pivot, or Growth
Click the card that best matches your ambition
Proceed to the next step (Resume Upload)
You can change this later in Settings → Career Goals

title: Understanding the Path Generation Process
summary: After uploading your resume, Kintsu analyzes your experience to craft a personalized career path.
canonical_questions: What happens after I upload my resume?
How long does path generation take?
Why is Kintsu analyzing my resume?
answer: Path Generation is where Kintsu's AI analyzes your resume to identify your strengths, map career opportunities, and craft your personalized golden path forward. This typically takes 5-10 seconds and includes steps like: analyzing experience, identifying strengths, mapping opportunities, and crafting your path.
examples: Progress shows as circular completion (0-100%)
Each step animates with visual feedback

title: Navigating Your Journey Map
summary: The Journey Map is a horizontal timeline showing your career milestones from past achievements to future goals.
canonical_questions: How do I use the timeline?
answer: Your Journey Map is the centerpiece of your dashboard - a horizontal scrollable timeline with milestone cards representing your career progression. Completed milestones appear in grayscale, your active milestone has a golden ring glow, upcoming milestones are ready to unlock, and locked milestones require completing prerequisites.
step_by_step: View the horizontal timeline under 'Your Journey'
Scroll left/right or use arrow buttons (desktop)
Click any unlocked milestone to open it
examples: Active milestone: AI Career Coach (35% progress)
Locked milestone: 'Complete Career Pathways to unlock'

title: Using the AI Career Coach
summary: Get personalized career guidance, interview prep, and strategy recommendations from Kintsu's AI Coach.
canonical_questions: How do I use the AI Coach?
What can the Career Coach help with?
How to ask the AI questions?
answer: The AI Career Coach provides personalized guidance on interview prep, resume optimization, salary negotiation, and career strategy. Free plan users get 10 messages per month, while Pro users have unlimited access. Simply type your question and Kintsu will respond with tailored advice based on your profile and goals.
step_by_step: Navigate to /app/coach or click Coach in the Journey Map
Type your career question in the input field
examples: 'How should I prepare for a senior developer interview?'
'What salary range should I target for my experience?'
'Help me improve my resume summary'
if_not_work: Check your message limit (Settings → Usage)
Ensure you have an active session
Try refreshing if responses stop appearing

title: Understanding AI Coach Message Limits
summary: Free plan users get 10 AI Coach messages per month. Pro users have unlimited access.
canonical_questions: How many messages can I send?
What happens when I hit my limit?
answer: Kintsu's Free plan includes 10 AI Coach messages per month to help you get started. Each question-answer exchange counts as one message. Pro users ($19/month) get unlimited messages plus priority responses. Your limit resets on the 1st of each month.
step_by_step: Check your current usage at Settings → Usage
See remaining messages in the Coach interface header
When you reach 10/10, you'll see an upgrade prompt
Upgrade to Pro for unlimited access
examples: Free: 10 messages/month
Pro: Unlimited messages
Resets on the 1st of each month
if_not_work: Check if you're logged in
Verify your plan status in Settings
Wait until next month for reset
Upgrade to Pro for immediate access

title: Optimizing Your Resume for ATS
summary: Learn how to format your resume to pass Applicant Tracking Systems and get noticed by recruiters.
canonical_questions: How do I make my resume ATS-friendly?
Why isn't my resume getting through?
How to format resume for applicant tracking?
answer: ATS (Applicant Tracking Systems) scan resumes before humans see them. Kintsu analyzes your resume for ATS compatibility and provides specific recommendations. Key factors: use standard headings (Experience, Education), avoid tables/graphics, include relevant keywords, use common fonts, and save as .docx or PDF.
examples: Use 'Work Experience' not 'Where I've Worked'
Include job-specific keywords from job description
Avoid headers/footers with contact info
Use standard fonts (Arial, Calibri, Times)
if_not_work: Ensure resume is in PDF or DOCX format
Remove images, charts, or complex tables
Simplify formatting to basic text
Ask AI Coach for specific optimization tips

title: Updating Your Resume After Feedback
summary: Use Kintsu's AI-powered feedback to strengthen your resume and increase interview callbacks.
canonical_questions: How do I improve my resume?
Where can I see resume feedback?
How to update resume with suggestions?
answer: After uploading your resume, Kintsu's AI analyzes it across 12 dimensions including impact, clarity, keyword optimization, and ATS compatibility. Navigate to Insights → Resume Repair to see detailed feedback with before/after examples.
examples: Weak: 'Responsible for sales' → Strong: 'Increased sales by 32% in Q3'
Weak: 'Worked on projects' → Strong: 'Led 5-person team delivering $2M project'
if_not_work: Ensure you're on Free or Pro plan (Resume Repair available to all)
Try refreshing if feedback doesn't load
Check that resume uploaded successfully

title: Tailoring Your Resume for Specific Jobs
summary: Create job-specific resume versions that highlight relevant experience and keywords.
canonical_questions: Should I customize my resume for each job?
How do I tailor my resume?
Can Kintsu help with job-specific resumes?
How to match resume to job description?
answer: Yes! Tailoring your resume increases interview chances by 40%. Kintsu's AI can analyze a job description and recommend which skills to emphasize, which experience to highlight, and what keywords to include. Navigate to Insights → Job Match Analyzer.
step_by_step: Go to Insights → Job Match Analyzer
Review the match score and gaps
examples: For 'React Developer' role: emphasize React projects, component architecture
For 'Team Lead' role: highlight leadership, mentoring, process improvements
if_not_work: Ensure job description is at least 100 words
Check that you have a base resume uploaded
Try with a different job posting

title: Understanding Your Career Pathways
summary: Explore personalized career paths based on your skills, experience, and goals.
canonical_questions: How do I see my career options?
What roles can I transition to?
answer: Career Pathways shows you personalized role progressions based on your current skills and chosen goal (Promotion, Pivot, or Growth). Each pathway includes required skills, typical timeline, salary ranges, and success stories from professionals who made similar transitions.
step_by_step: Explore alternative paths by clicking 'See More'
Click any role to see detailed requirements
Save interesting paths to your Journey Map
examples: Junior Dev → Mid-Level Dev → Senior Dev → Tech Lead
Frontend Dev → Full-Stack Dev → Engineering Manager
Marketing Analyst → Product Marketing → Product Manager

title: Identifying Skill Gaps for Your Next Role
summary: Discover what skills you need to develop to reach your target position.
canonical_questions: What skills do I need to learn?
How do I know my skill gaps?
How to prepare for next role?
answer: Kintsu compares your current skills (from your resume) against requirements for your target role. Navigate to Pathways → Skill Gap Analysis to see a visual breakdown of what you have, what you're missing, and recommended learning resources.
step_by_step: Go to Pathways → Select target role
Review the skills matrix (Have / Learning / Need)
Click 'Get Resources' for courses and certifications
Add skills to your learning plan
examples: For Senior Developer: Need system design, mentoring, architecture
For Product Manager: Need roadmapping, stakeholder management, analytics
if_not_work: Ensure you've completed onboarding and uploaded resume
Select a specific target role first
Try refreshing the analysis

title: Setting Career Milestones and Goals
summary: Break down your career ambitions into achievable milestones with timelines and tracking.
canonical_questions: How do I set career goals?
answer: Milestones are concrete achievements on your journey to your target role. Kintsu automatically creates milestones based on your pathway (e.g., 'Complete React certification', 'Lead a project team', 'Build portfolio site'). You can also create custom milestones.
step_by_step: Choose from suggested or create custom
examples: Milestone: Complete AWS Certification (Due: Q2 2025)
Milestone: Deliver 3 successful product launches (Due: Dec 2025)
Milestone: Mentor 2 junior developers (Due: Ongoing)

title: Exploring Alternative Career Pivots
summary: Discover non-obvious career transitions that match your transferable skills.
canonical_questions: What other careers can I pursue?
Can I switch from tech to product?
answer: If you selected 'Career Pivot' as your goal, Kintsu identifies alternative roles where your skills transfer effectively. For example, developers often pivot to Product Management, UX Design, or Developer Relations. Each pivot shows success rate, timeline, and required upskilling.
step_by_step: Click any role to see detailed transition guide
Read success stories from similar backgrounds
examples: Developer → Product Manager (75% success rate, 12-18 months)
Marketing → UX Research (68% success rate, 6-12 months)
Teacher → Instructional Designer (82% success rate, 3-6 months)

title: Understanding Your Salary Insights
summary: Get data-driven salary benchmarks for your role, experience level, and location.
canonical_questions: What's the market rate for my role?
answer: Kintsu's Salary Insights analyzes your resume against 500,000+ job postings to estimate your market value. You'll see salary ranges for your current role, target roles, and geographic variations. Data updates weekly.
step_by_step: Review your estimated market value range
See how your skills affect compensation
examples: Senior Frontend Developer, SF: $145K-$185K
Product Manager, NYC: $130K-$170K
Data Analyst, Remote: $85K-$115K
if_not_work: Ensure resume includes job title and location
Check that you have 1+ year of experience listed
Data may be limited for very niche roles

title: Using Market Trends to Guide Your Career
summary: See which skills are growing in demand and which roles are hiring most actively.
answer: Market Trends shows real-time hiring data across industries and roles. You'll see demand growth for specific skills (e.g., 'React demand +23% YoY'), fastest-growing roles, and declining skill areas to avoid.
step_by_step: Filter by your industry or role type
Click 'Skill Demand' to see trending technologies
Save trends to track over time
examples: AI/ML skills: +45% demand growth
Cloud Architecture: +31% demand growth
jQuery: -12% demand decline

title: Tracking Your Application Success Rate
summary: Monitor your job application metrics and identify areas for improvement.
canonical_questions: How many applications should I send?
Why am I not getting interviews?
answer: Kintsu's Application Tracker monitors your job search metrics: applications sent, response rate, interview conversion, and offer rate. You'll see benchmarks compared to similar profiles and AI-powered recommendations to improve each stage.
step_by_step: Review your funnel: Applied → Responded → Interview → Offer
Compare your rates to industry benchmarks
Click 'Improve This Stage' for specific tips
examples: Benchmark response rate: 15-25%
Benchmark interview rate: 8-12%
If your response rate is <10%, focus on resume optimization
if_not_work: Manually add applications if not auto-tracked
Ensure you've applied to at least 10 jobs for meaningful data
Data updates every 24 hours

title: Analyzing Your LinkedIn Profile Strength
summary: Get AI recommendations to optimize your LinkedIn profile for recruiter visibility.
canonical_questions: How can I improve my LinkedIn?
How to get noticed by recruiters?
answer: Kintsu analyzes your LinkedIn profile across 8 dimensions: headline effectiveness, about section clarity, experience descriptions, skills endorsements, recommendations, activity level, and keyword optimization. You'll get a profile strength score and specific improvement suggestions.
step_by_step: Expand each section for detailed feedback
examples: Weak headline: 'Software Engineer' → Strong: 'Senior Full-Stack Engineer | React & Node.js | Building Scalable SaaS'
Add 3-5 relevant skills to reach 'All-Star' status
if_not_work: Ensure LinkedIn connection is authorized
Check that your profile is set to Public
Try disconnecting and reconnecting

title: Understanding Your Skill Confidence Scores
summary: See how confident Kintsu is about your proficiency in each listed skill.
canonical_questions: How does Kintsu assess my skills?
Why is my skill confidence low?
answer: Skill Confidence Scores (0-100) indicate how well your resume demonstrates proficiency. High scores (80+) mean you have strong evidence (years of experience, projects, impact metrics). Low scores (<50) suggest listing skills without context. Add project examples and metrics to improve scores.
step_by_step: View your skills sorted by confidence
Click any skill to see evidence sources
Add projects or certifications to boost scores
examples: React: 85/100 (3 years experience, 5 projects mentioned)
Python: 42/100 (listed but no projects shown)
Leadership: 78/100 (managed teams, quantified impact)

title: Preparing for Behavioral Interviews
summary: Use Kintsu's AI Coach to practice STAR-method responses and build confidence.
canonical_questions: How do I prepare for behavioral interviews?
Can Kintsu help me practice interviews?
How to answer 'Tell me about a time...'?
answer: Behavioral interviews ask about past experiences using questions like 'Tell me about a time you led a team.' Kintsu's AI Coach helps you craft STAR responses (Situation, Task, Action, Result) based on your actual experience from your resume.
step_by_step: Type 'Help me prepare for behavioral interview'
Kinto will ask about your target role
Get feedback on your STAR structure
examples: Q: 'Tell me about a conflict at work' → STAR: Situation (team disagreement), Task (find consensus), Action (facilitated meeting), Result (delivered on time)
Q: 'Describe a failure' → Always include what you learned
if_not_work: Ensure you have Coach messages remaining (check limit)
Try being more specific about the role/company
Ask for different question types

title: Getting Technical Interview Help
summary: Practice coding problems, system design, and technical concepts with AI guidance.
canonical_questions: Can Kintsu help with technical interviews?
How to prepare for coding interviews?
Does the AI Coach know algorithms?
answer: Yes! The AI Coach can explain algorithms, review your approach to coding problems, help with system design patterns, and suggest practice resources. It won't solve problems for you, but will guide your thinking and identify knowledge gaps.
step_by_step: Ask about specific topics (e.g., 'Explain binary search trees')
Describe your solution approach for feedback
examples: 'How do I approach a two-pointer problem?'
'Review my approach to designing a URL shortener'
'What data structures should I know for FAANG?'

title: Negotiating Your Job Offer
summary: Get personalized negotiation strategies based on your offer, market data, and leverage.
canonical_questions: How to respond to a job offer?
answer: Kintsu's AI Coach provides negotiation scripts, counter-offer ranges, and timing advice based on your specific situation. Share your offer details (Kinto keeps it confidential) and get personalized guidance on salary, equity, sign-on bonus, and benefits.
step_by_step: Type 'I received a job offer, help me negotiate'
Share offer details (base, equity, bonus, etc.)
Review Kinto's market comparison and leverage analysis
Get specific counter-offer script and timing advice
examples: 'They offered $120K base. Market rate is $135K. How do I ask for more?'
'Should I prioritize equity or base salary?'
'How to negotiate remote work flexibility?'
if_not_work: Provide specific numbers for better advice
Share your years of experience and location
Ask follow-up questions to refine strategy

title: Understanding What Questions to Ask Interviewers
summary: Get smart, role-specific questions that show your strategic thinking and culture fit.
canonical_questions: What should I ask in interviews?
answer: Asking thoughtful questions is crucial. Kintsu's AI Coach generates role-specific questions based on the company, role level, and interview stage. Avoid generic questions like 'What's the culture like?' and ask strategic ones that show research and critical thinking.
step_by_step: Type 'What should I ask in my [role] interview at [company]?'
Review the suggested questions across 4 categories
Pick 3-5 questions that feel authentic to you
Take notes on the answers during interview
examples: Strategic: 'What's the biggest technical challenge the team is facing in the next 6 months?'
Culture: 'Can you describe how the team handled a recent project setback?'
Growth: 'What does success look like in this role after 12 months?'

title: Crafting Your Professional Summary
summary: Write a compelling resume summary that captures your value in 3-4 sentences.
canonical_questions: How do I write a resume summary?
How long should my summary be?
answer: Your professional summary (3-4 sentences at the top of your resume) should highlight: (1) your role/expertise, (2) years of experience, (3) key technical/soft skills, and (4) what you're seeking. Kintsu can generate personalized summaries based on your experience and target role.
step_by_step: Type 'Help me write my resume summary for [target role]'
Kinto will ask about your background
examples: Senior Full-Stack Engineer with 6+ years building scalable SaaS products. Expert in React, Node.js, and AWS. Led teams of 5+ developers delivering $10M+ in revenue features. Seeking Staff Engineer role to drive technical strategy.

Product Manager with 4 years launching B2B software. Skilled in roadmapping, user research, and cross-functional leadership. Increased user engagement 45% through data-driven feature prioritization. Targeting Senior PM role in EdTech.

title: Quantifying Your Achievements
summary: Transform vague accomplishments into measurable impact statements that impress recruiters.
canonical_questions: How do I add metrics to my resume?
What if I don't have numbers?
answer: Metrics make your resume stand out. Instead of 'Improved performance,' write 'Reduced API latency by 40%, improving user satisfaction by 25%.' Kintsu's AI Coach helps you identify quantifiable achievements even when numbers aren't obvious.
step_by_step: Ask yourself: How much? How many? How fast?
Convert vague statements to impact format
examples: Vague: 'Led a team' → Quantified: 'Led 7-person engineering team delivering 15+ features/quarter'
Vague: 'Improved user experience' → Quantified: 'Redesigned onboarding, reducing time-to-value from 10 min to 3 min (70% improvement)'
Vague: 'Mentored juniors' → Quantified: 'Mentored 3 junior developers, with 2 promoted within 12 months'

title: Handling Resume Gaps and Career Breaks
summary: Address employment gaps confidently with strategic framing and honest transparency.
canonical_questions: How do I explain a resume gap?
answer: Resume gaps are common and increasingly accepted. The key is honest, brief explanation. Kintsu's AI Coach helps you frame gaps positively (e.g., 'Career break to care for family' or 'Sabbatical for professional development'). Focus the conversation back on your skills and readiness.
step_by_step: Add brief explanation on resume if gap >6 months
Emphasize what you did during the gap (courses, freelance, family)
examples: 2022-2023: Parental leave and professional upskilling (completed AWS certification)
2021: Health recovery and portfolio development
2020: Traveled while freelancing remotely for 3 clients
if_not_work: Be honest, not defensive
Keep explanation brief (1 line on resume)
Shift focus to skills and readiness
Practice your verbal explanation

title: Choosing the Right Resume Format
summary: Select between chronological, functional, or combination resume formats based on your situation.
canonical_questions: What resume format should I use?
When to use a combination format?
answer: Resume format matters. **Chronological** (most common): lists jobs in reverse time order—best for linear career progression. **Functional**: emphasizes skills over timeline—best for career changers or gaps. **Combination**: hybrid of both—best for senior roles. Kintsu recommends formats based on your situation.
step_by_step: If linear progression with no gaps: use Chronological
If changing careers or have gaps: consider Functional
If senior with diverse experience: try Combination
Ask /app/coach 'What resume format should I use?'
examples: Chronological: Senior Engineer with 8 years at 3 companies (standard progression)
Functional: Teacher transitioning to UX Design (emphasize transferable skills)
Combination: VP Engineering with IC + management experience

title: Building a Portfolio to Showcase Your Work
summary: Create a professional portfolio that demonstrates your skills through real projects and case studies.
answer: Portfolios are essential for designers, developers, writers, and product managers. They show, not tell. Include 3-5 best projects with context (problem, your role, solution, impact). Kintsu's AI Coach helps structure case studies and recommends portfolio platforms (Notion, Webflow, GitHub).
step_by_step: For each, write: Problem → Process → Solution → Impact
Ask /app/coach to review your case study structure
Host on a custom domain or platform
examples: Developer: GitHub repo + deployed demo + README explaining architecture
Designer: Figma prototype + user research findings + before/after metrics
PM: Product spec + launch results + lessons learned

title: Understanding Free vs Pro Plan Features
summary: Compare Kintsu's Free and Pro plans to choose the right level for your career stage.
canonical_questions: What's included in the Free plan?
answer: **Free Plan**: 1 resume upload, 10 AI Coach messages/month, basic insights, 3 pathway recommendations. **Pro Plan ($19/month)**: Unlimited resumes, unlimited Coach messages, advanced insights, LinkedIn optimization, salary data, priority support, and early access to new features.
step_by_step: Start with Free to test Kintsu
If you hit Coach message limit, consider Pro
Pro is best during active job search (2-3 months)
Upgrade at Settings → Billing → Choose Pro
examples: Free: Great for exploratory career planning
Pro: Essential during active job search or career transition
Pro ROI: If it helps you negotiate $5K+ more salary, it pays for itself
if_not_work: Check your current plan at Settings → Billing
Contact support for student/nonprofit discounts
Free plan limits reset on 1st of each month

title: Upgrading to Pro
summary: Start your 14-day Pro trial or subscribe to unlock unlimited AI guidance and advanced insights.
canonical_questions: How do I upgrade to Pro?
What payment methods do you accept?
answer: Kintsu Pro includes a 14-day free trial (no credit card required for first 7 days). After trial, it's $19/month billed monthly. We accept all major credit cards via Stripe. Cancel anytime with no penalty—your Pro features remain active until the end of your billing period.
step_by_step: Cancel anytime from Settings → Billing → Manage Subscription
examples: Trial Day 1-14: Full Pro access
Trial Day 15: First charge of $19
Then $19/month until you cancel
if_not_work: Check if you already used a trial (1 per account)
Ensure payment method is valid
Try a different browser if checkout fails
Contact support for billing issues

title: Managing Your Subscription
summary: Update payment info, view billing history, or cancel your subscription from your account settings.
canonical_questions: How do I cancel my subscription?
How to update my credit card?
answer: All subscription management happens in Settings → Billing. You can update payment methods, view invoices, see your next renewal date, and cancel your subscription. Cancellation is immediate but you retain Pro access until the end of your current billing period.
step_by_step: To update card: Click 'Update Payment Method'
examples: Renewal: Charged on the same day each month
Cancellation: Access continues until period ends
Invoices: Available as PDF downloads
if_not_work: Clear browser cache if settings won't load
Use desktop browser (not mobile) for best experience
Contact support for failed payment issues

title: Updating Your Account Information
summary: Change your email, password, name, and notification preferences from account settings.
canonical_questions: How do I change my email?
answer: Navigate to Settings → Account to update your personal information. You can change your email (requires verification), reset your password, update your name/location, and manage notification preferences (email, push, SMS).
step_by_step: Edit any field and click 'Save Changes'
For email changes: verify via confirmation link
For password: click 'Change Password' → enter current + new
examples: Email change: Must verify both old and new email
Password: Must be 8+ characters with mix of letters/numbers
Notifications: Toggle weekly digest, milestone updates, etc.
if_not_work: Check spam folder for verification emails
Ensure new email isn't already in use
For password reset issues, use 'Forgot Password' on login page

title: Managing Privacy and Data Settings
summary: Control what data Kintsu collects, who can see your profile, and how to export or delete your data.
answer: Kintsu takes privacy seriously. Your resume and conversations are never shared without permission. Navigate to Settings → Privacy to control: profile visibility (public/private), data sharing preferences, export your data (JSON), or permanently delete your account.
step_by_step: Click 'Export My Data' for full JSON download
examples: Public profile: Visible to recruiters (opt-in)
Private: Only you can access your data
Export includes: resume, conversations, milestones, insights
if_not_work: Data export may take up to 24 hours
Account deletion requires password confirmation
Deleted data cannot be recovered

title: Troubleshooting Login Issues
summary: Resolve common login problems including forgotten passwords, locked accounts, and verification errors.
canonical_questions: I can't log in, what do I do?
answer: Common login issues: (1) Wrong password—use 'Forgot Password' to reset. (2) Account locked after 5 failed attempts—wait 15 minutes or contact support. (3) Email not verified—check spam for verification link. (4) Browser issues—clear cache or try incognito mode.
step_by_step: Enter your email → check inbox for reset link
If account locked, wait 15 min or contact support
For verification issues, click 'Resend Verification Email'
examples: Password reset link expires in 1 hour
Account auto-unlocks after 15 minutes
Verification emails sent from noreply@kintsu.io
if_not_work: Check spam/junk folder
Ensure email is typed correctly
Try different browser or device
Contact support@kintsu.io with your email

title: Fixing Resume Upload Errors
summary: Resolve issues with resume uploads including file format, size, and processing errors.
answer: Resume upload requirements: PDF, DOC, or DOCX format, under 10MB, text-based (not scanned images). Common issues: (1) File too large—compress or remove images. (2) Scanned PDF—use text-based PDF. (3) Browser timeout—try Chrome or Firefox. (4) Corrupted file—re-save from original source.
step_by_step: Verify file is PDF, DOC, or DOCX
Ensure it's text-based, not a scanned image
Try different browser if upload fails
Re-save file from original source (Word, Google Docs)
examples: Supported: resume.pdf (3MB, text)
Not supported: resume.png, resume-scanned.pdf (image)
Too large: resume-with-huge-images.pdf (15MB)
if_not_work: Compress PDF using online tools
Remove images/graphics
Export from Word/Docs as new file
Contact support with error message

title: AI Coach Not Responding
summary: Fix issues when the AI Coach doesn't reply or responses are delayed.
answer: If Kinto isn't responding: (1) Check your message limit (Free: 10/month, Settings → Usage). (2) Verify internet connection. (3) Refresh the page if stuck loading >30 seconds. (4) Try a simpler, more specific question. (5) Check system status at status.kintsu.io.
step_by_step: If under limit, refresh the page
If still failing, check status.kintsu.io or contact support
examples: Too vague: 'Help with career' → Better: 'How do I prepare for a PM interview at Google?'
Too complex: Multi-part question → Better: Break into separate messages
if_not_work: Clear browser cache and cookies
Try incognito/private mode
Use desktop browser (mobile may have issues)
Wait 5 minutes and retry (could be temporary outage)

title: Dashboard Not Loading or Showing Errors
summary: Troubleshoot blank screens, infinite loading, or error messages on your dashboard.
answer: Dashboard loading issues are often browser-related. Try: (1) Hard refresh (Ctrl+Shift+R or Cmd+Shift+R). (2) Clear cache and cookies. (3) Disable browser extensions (especially ad blockers). (4) Try different browser. (5) Check status.kintsu.io for outages.
step_by_step: Press Ctrl+Shift+R (Windows) or Cmd+Shift+R (Mac) for hard refresh
If still broken, clear cache: Browser Settings → Clear browsing data
Disable extensions: Try incognito mode to test
examples: Error 500: Server issue, check status page
Blank screen: Usually cache or extension conflict
Infinite loading: Network issue, check connection
if_not_work: Test on mobile device (different network)
Check firewall/VPN settings
Wait 10-15 minutes and retry
Report issue to support@kintsu.io with screenshot

title: Contacting Kintsu Support
summary: Get help from the Kintsu team via email, chat, or help center for issues not covered in the knowledge base.
canonical_questions: I need help with something not listed
answer: Kintsu support is available via: (1) Email: support@kintsu.io (response within 24 hours). (2) In-app chat: Click 'Talk to Human' in the Kinto widget (Pro users get priority). (3) Help center: help.kintsu.io. Include your account email, description of issue, and screenshots if applicable.
step_by_step: For urgent issues: Click 'Talk to Human' in chat widget
Include: account email, issue description, screenshots
Pro users: Expect response within 4 hours
Free users: Expect response within 24 hours
examples: Good subject: 'Resume upload failing with error 413'
Bad subject: 'Help'
Include: Browser version, error message, what you tried
if_not_work: Check spam folder for support replies
Ensure email is from your Kintsu account
Try different contact method if no response in 48 hours

title: Connecting LinkedIn to Kintsu
summary: Securely link your LinkedIn profile to unlock profile optimization insights and recruiter visibility features.
answer: Connecting LinkedIn (via secure OAuth) allows Kintsu to analyze your profile strength, suggest optimizations, and optionally make your profile visible to recruiters. We never post on your behalf or share data without permission. Navigate to Settings → Integrations → LinkedIn.
step_by_step: Sign in to LinkedIn (OAuth secure flow)
Authorize Kintsu to read profile data
Return to Kintsu to see insights
examples: What we access: Profile data, experience, skills (read-only)
What we DON'T do: Post, message, or change your profile
Result: Profile strength score + optimization tips
if_not_work: Ensure popup blockers are disabled
Try different browser if OAuth fails
Check that LinkedIn account is active
Disconnect and reconnect if data not syncing

title: Understanding Data Security and Encryption
summary: Learn how Kintsu protects your personal data, resume, and conversations with industry-standard security.
answer: Kintsu uses bank-level security: (1) All data encrypted in transit (TLS 1.3) and at rest (AES-256). (2) Resume data never shared with third parties. (3) AI conversations are anonymized before analysis. (4) SOC 2 Type II compliant. (5) Regular security audits. (6) Optional 2FA for account protection.
step_by_step: Export your data anytime: Settings → Privacy → Export
Delete account: Settings → Privacy → Delete Account (permanent)
examples: Encryption: Military-grade AES-256
Compliance: SOC 2, GDPR, CCPA
Access: Only you and authorized Kintsu systems

title: Using Kintsu on Mobile Devices
summary: Access Kintsu's full feature set on your phone or tablet via mobile-optimized web app.
canonical_questions: Can I use Kintsu on my phone?
answer: Kintsu is fully mobile-responsive via web (no app download needed). Visit app.kintsu.io on your mobile browser for optimized touch experience. Key features work seamlessly: AI Coach, Journey Map (swipe navigation), resume upload, insights. For best experience, add to home screen (works like a native app).
step_by_step: Tap Share → Add to Home Screen (iOS)
Or Menu → Add to Home Screen (Android)
App icon now on home screen, works offline-capable
examples: Mobile-optimized: Bottom nav, swipe gestures, touch-friendly buttons
Works offline: View cached insights and resume
Native feel: Full-screen, no browser chrome
if_not_work: Use desktop for resume upload if mobile fails
Ensure mobile browser is updated
Some features (bulk editing) work better on desktop
